business.headline: ICICI Bank hikes minimum savings balance to Rs 50,000: What it means for youThe change applies to all new accounts opened after that date, setting a new benchmark in the industry for the highest MAB requirement among domestic banks.

Ease of doing business: Piyush Goyal resolves Swiss firm's land issue in hoursUnion Minister Piyush Goyal resolved a complex land allocation issue for a major Swiss company during a live business conference, highlighting the ease of business in India.

Trump's tariff war: Is this India's 1991 moment? Montek Singh Ahluwalia exclusiveAt the Business Today India@100 Summit, Montek Singh Ahluwalia, former Deputy Chairman of the Planning Commission, discusses if the 2025 Trump tariff war presents a 1991-like moment for India.

Piyush Goyal exclusive: Whole world recognises India as fastest-growing economyUnion Minister Piyush Goyal hailed the Indian economy and said the whole world recognises us as the fastest-growing large economy.

'A win for India': Piyush Goyal on clinching UK free trade dealUnion Minister Piyush Goyal, speaking at the Business Today India@100 Summit, called the India-UK free trade deal a big win for the country.

Cabinet approves Rs 30,000 crore subsidy to oil companies to keep LPG prices stableThe decision aims to protect consumers from changes in global LPG prices and support the financial health of the public sector oil companies.

Sensex cracks below 80,000 as tariff fears rattle stock marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 765.47 points to close below the psychological 80,000 mark, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 232.85 points to settle at 24,363.30. Midcap and smallcap stocks witnessed deeper cuts, reflecting growing investor unease over the evolving global trade scenario.

India not a dead economy, poised to become 3rd-largest in world: Amitabh KantAfter Donald Trump's 'dead economy' jibe, Amitabh Kant calls India a resilient, reform-driven powerhouse on track to become the world's third-largest economy.

US tariff surge could stall India's manufacturing momentum, warns Moody'sOn Thursday, US President Donald Trump signed an Executive Order that adds a 25% tariff on Indian goods. This move comes in response to India's continued import of oil from Russia.

How much will India's fuel bill rise if it stops buying oil from Russia?Russia currently provides 10% of the world's crude supply. If multiple countries stop buying from Russia at once, crude oil prices could rise by around 10%, as per the report. That would affect everyone, not just India.
Gold hits record high of Rs 1.02 lakh. Is it the right time to buy?The rally in gold comes amid growing concerns over new tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump.

Arvind Panagariya bets on these states to leads India's growth by 2047Arvind Panagariya explained that India doesn't need to push growth artificially. He believes market forces are already at work, shaping the country's growth naturally.

Nitin Gadkari dismisses concerns over ethanol-blended petrol as misinformationUnion Minister Nitin Gadkari firmly defended the government's ethanol-blended petrol initiative, stating that no complaints have surfaced about vehicle issues. Speaking at the India@100 Summit, he challenged critics to cite a single case of malfunction and accused them of spreading baseless misinformation.

Nitin Gadkari's dare on E20 petrol row: Show a single instance of cars facing issueSpeaking at a session during the Business Today India@100 Summit, Nitin Gadkari said no complaints had been reported so far and accused detractors of spreading misinformation about the government's ethanol-blending programme.

NSDL shares are on a dream run after listing. Should you buy now?The NSDL stock, which made its market debut on August 6, has now risen for three straight sessions—prompting IPO investors to ask: is it time to book profits or hold on?

Want to save tax by claiming HRA for rent paid to parents? Read this firstAccording to tax rules, salaried individuals can claim HRA even if they're living in their parents' home. But the rent must be real, paid regularly, and documented properly.

Government may approve Rs 30,000 crore support to maintain LPG price stabilityThis move is aimed at helping oil marketing companies recover losses they have been facing on domestic LPG sales due to high international prices.
Sensex tumbles 500 points: Why is the stock market down today?At 10:07 am, the Sensex was down 496.21 points at 80,127.05, while the Nifty stood at 24,444.55, lower by 151.60 points.

Retail inflation likely dropped to an eight-year low in July: ReportDespite uneven monsoons, a strong spring harvest has helped India keep a lid on food prices, extending the country's longest disinflationary streak in more than a decade.

Sensex, Nifty tumble as Trump's threat on trade deal spooks Dalal StreetAt the opening bell, the S&P BSE Sensex fell over 150 points and was trading 310.53 points lower at 80,312.73 around 9:35 am. The broader Nifty50 index also slipped 84.55 points to 24,511.60.

Trump rules out trade talks with India amid tariffs: Will Dalal Street face the heat?With Donald Trump ruling out any negotiations "until it is resolved," Dalal Street could witness a turbulent period as geopolitical tensions spill into the market.

Trump's tariff: What Indian refiners stand to lose if Russian oil stops flowingFor over two years, Indian refiners have been taking advantage of discounted Russian crude. But with the US tightening its stance, that door may soon begin to close.

US targets one-kilo gold bars with new import tariffs: ReportFollowing the US government's announcement last week of a broad 39% tariff on imports from Switzerland, this exacerbates already existing trade tensions between Bern and Washington.

Trump tariffs: US consumers face price hikes across major brandsIn the household goods sector, Procter & Gamble said it plans to raise prices on 25% of its North American products due to the impact of tariffs and product innovation.

Despite war and warnings, US traded more with Russia than ally UkraineUS President Donald Trump alleges that India has been financing the Russian invasion of Ukraine by importing oil. However, data by the US Census Bureau presents a different picture.

How India plans to tackle Trump's tariff threatIndia has already held five rounds of trade talks with the US, but no deal has been reached. The talks failed mainly because of disagreements over opening India's farm and dairy sectors, and the issue of buying oil from Russia.

Indian refiners hit pause on Russian oil imports after 50% tariff blow: ReportRefiners like Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum Corporation and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation have decided not to buy Russian oil on the spot market in the upcoming buying cycle.
Sensex, Nifty end in green as D-Street investors ignore Trump's 50% tariffsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 79.27 points to end at 80,623.26, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 21.95 points to close at 24,596.15.

Why STP and SWP matter more than SIP, explains stock market expertSIPs help you enter the world of investing. But STPs and SWPs help you navigate it wisely, especially when you have a big lump sum to invest or need steady income without eating into your entire savings.

From ally to 'dead economy': Timeline of Trump's tariff turn on IndiaTrump signed an executive order imposing an additional 25% tariff on Indian goods, bringing the total to 50% on August 6, putting India among the most heavily tariffed nations.

Nayara Energy seeks ships from India to ferry refined fuels: ReportSanctions-hit Nayara is struggling to get vessels for the supply of refined fuels for its retail stations in India. The private refiner has already cut crude runs at its refinery.

Adani to build India's biggest privately funded coal power plant in a decadeThe first of three units at the plant will be commissioned within four years, with the last expected to come online in five years' time, Adani Power said.

TCS hikes salaries for 80% staff amid layoffs: ReportIn a message sent to employees, the company confirmed that the salary increase will apply to around 80% of the workforce and will take effect from September 1, 2025.

How Trump's 100% chip tariff plan has shaken the global semiconductor industrySpeaking from the Oval Office, Trump said the move is aimed at boosting local manufacturing and reducing reliance on foreign-made chips. He added that companies like Apple, which recently committed an extra $100 billion investment in the US, would not be charged the new tariffs.

Trump hits India with 50% tariffs: What's at stake and what next?A sweeping 50% tariff could significantly impact India's export economy, threatening jobs and trade ties. As Donald Trump ramps up pressure, all eyes are now on New Delhi's next move.

From seafood to auto: How will Trump's 50% tariff impact different sectorsThe tariff hike, set to take effect from August 27, follows a warning issued by Trump earlier over India's continued oil imports from Russia.

Skipped your ITR for years? Here's how it can impact you legally and financiallyIt might feel harmless to skip filing your Income Tax Return once or twice, but if you've been ignoring it for years, you could be heading for serious trouble. From steep penalties to even jail time, here's what you need to know before it's too late.

JSW Cement IPO opens for subscription. Should you apply or skip?Brokerages are mostly positive about JSW Cement IPO, though some advise caution due to the stretched valuation and inconsistent profitability.

Sensex tanks 500 points on 50% Trump's tariff blow: Should Investors worry?The Sensex slipped over 250 points at the open before paring some losses. The Nifty50 was also trading lower, reflecting broad-based caution and expectations of a volatile trading session.

entertainment.headline: Brothers Ram Charan, Varun Tej, Sai Tej flaunt rugged look in viral Sunday gym picRam Charan and his cousins, Varun Tej and Sai Tej, hit the gym on Sunday. They shared the picture via a joint post on Instagram.

Ahaan Panday's mother Deanne shares note for son, thanks Saiyaara director and teamAhaan Panday's debut film 'Saiyaara' became a superhit, earning Rs 500 crore worldwide without any promotions. His mother, Deanne Panday, shared an emotional Instagram post thanking the film's team and expressing how proud she is of her son.

Saiyaara actors Ahaan Panday-Aneet Padda turn camera on paps, video goes viralAfter 'Saiyaara' became a huge hit, newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda had fun with Mumbai paparazzi by recording them, and the video quickly went viral.

War 2 advance booking begins, Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR shine in new promo'War 2', starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, has opened advance bookings in India with a high-action promo showcasing their spy showdown. Directed by Ayan Mukerji, the film is set for a massive August 14, 2025 release on 5,000 screens in Hindi alone.

Hina Khan says people were hesitant to cast after her cancer diagnosisHina Khan made a strong comeback with 'Pati Patni Aur Panga' a year after her breast cancer diagnosis, though she feels some hesitation from the industry in casting her.

Shekhar Kapur recalls being thrown out from Barsaat, replaced by Rajkumar SantoshiShekhar Kapur has clarified that he didn't walk out of Bobby Deol's debut film 'Barsaat' but was replaced by Rajkumar Santoshi after creative differences with Dharmendra. Despite the change, the film went on to become a commercial success and launch Bobby's Bollywood career.

Amaal Mallik opens up on rift with Bhushan Kumar, says it began over remix refusalAmaal Mallik opened up about his strained professional ties with T-Series head Bhushan Kumar, sharing that refusing to compose remixes led to their fallout. Despite creative differences, he described Bhushan as his "industry father" and credited him for shaping his career.

Anupam Kher shares hilarious confusion over modern public toilet signsAnupam Kher shared a humorous video on social media expressing his confusion over the complicated symbols used for public toilet signs.

Ajith-Shalini's tender temple moment delights fans, applies bindi on wifeA video of Ajith Kumar and his wife Shalini during a temple visit has gone viral, capturing a tender moment between the couple. It featured the actor applying bindi on his wife, while she touches his feet.

Not apologetic about my body: John Abraham on moving past stereotypes in filmsJohn Abraham spoke about breaking away from body stereotypes, choosing meaningful films, and the changing gender dynamics in Bollywood. He also promoted his upcoming spy thriller 'Tehran', set to release on Zee5 on August 14.

Kiara Advani's sweet note on motherhood wins hearts online: You change my worldKiara Advani has embraced motherhood with a heartfelt Instagram post, sharing tender moments from her new life as a mother to her baby girl. The actor welcomed her daughter on July 15.

Rajinikanth's Coolie sets box office ablaze ahead of release, crosses Rs 50 croreRajinikanth's 'Coolie' has surpassed Rs 50 crore in worldwide advance bookings, setting new records before its release. The film will hit theatres on August 14.

Abhishek-Aishwarya make rare airport sighting, daughter Aaradhya steals showThe Bachchan family created a buzz at Mumbai airport with their coordinated travel style and warm interactions. Videos of Abhishek Bachchan, Aishwarya Rai and daughter Aaradhya went viral on Sunday.

Udaipur Files producer Amit Jani alleges bomb, death threats after film releaseProducer Amit Jani of 'Udaipur Files' has received death threats after the film's release. The film, based on the 2022 murder of Kanhaiya Lal, faced censorship delays and legal hurdles before its eventual release on August 8.

Sholay's 50th anniversary: 4K restoration to premiere at Toronto Film FestivalThe Film Heritage Foundation has restored the iconic film 'Sholay' in 4K to celebrate its 50th anniversary, with a special premiere set at the Toronto International Film Festival.

Sushmita Sen calls her mother a hero, her blessing, in special birthday postSushmita Sen celebrated her mother Subhra Sen's birthday with a heartfelt Instagram post, calling her a "rockstar" and her "hero."

Priyanka Chopra recalls how she earned Barfi role despite director's doubts. WatchPriyanka Chopra looked back on her journey of portraying Jhilmil in 'Barfi!', a role director Anurag Basu initially couldn't envision her in. She shared how intense workshops, deep research, and stepping out of her comfort zone helped her bring the character to life.

Priyanka Chopra to Ibrahim Ali Khan, Bollywood celebs share Raksha Bandhan 2025 wishesBollywood stars marked Raksha Bandhan 2025 with emotional posts, sharing pictures and heartfelt messages for their siblings. Celebrities like Ibrahim Ali Khan, Priyanka Chopra, Parineeti Chopra, Ananya Panday, Karan Johar, and Kangana Ranaut expressed love and warm wishes on social media.

Was sobbing with gratitude: Sonu Nigam after Sidharth-Janhvi's Pardesiya releaseSonu Nigam was deeply moved by the overwhelming love for his latest song 'Pardesiya' from the film 'Param Sundari'. The film, starring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor, is eagerly awaited with its new release date set for August 29, 2025.

general news.headline: Sabka boss doesn't like India's rise: Rajnath Singh's swipe at Trump over tariffsDefence Minister Rajnath Singh slammed US President Donald Trump's tariff threats, asserting that despite efforts to hinder India's growth by making Indian products expensive, no global power can stop India from becoming a major world power.

Tejashwi Yadav alleges Bihar Deputy Chief Minister has 2 voter IDs. He clarifiesTejashwi Yadav accused Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Kumar Sinha of holding two voter IDs from different constituencies. Sinha denied wrongdoing, citing administrative error, and insisted he votes from only one place.

If you ask a Pakistani...: Army chief mocks Pak's Op Sindoor narrative managementArmy chief Gen Upendra Dwivedi likened Operation Sindoor to a game of chess, describing it as a 'grey zone' mission where both sides made unpredictable moves, posing significant operational challenges for India's forces against Pakistan.

PM Modi flags off 3 Vande Bharat trains in Bengaluru, inaugurates new metro linePrime Minister Narendra Modi visited Bengaluru on Sunday to unveil major transport upgrades, including three Vande Bharat trains, a new metro line, and more.

How India's Digital Nomads eat, pray, love while working remotelyArmed to work remotely during the Covid lockdown, and unfettered after it, India's professionals got hooked on the nomadic way of life, travelling while earning their daily dal-roti. India now has a huge band of Digital Nomads who aren't moored in any city, and are constantly travelling from place to place while working.

Pakistan lost Rs 1,240 crore in 2 months after closing airspace to Indian flightsBetween April 24 and June 30, Pakistan's overflying revenue fell by over Rs 1,240 crore after it barred Indian-registered aircraft, cutting daily transit traffic by up to 150 flights.

1 killed as speeding Thar rams pedestrians in Delhi; liquor bottles found in carA high-speeding Thar ran over two pedestrians, killing one on the spot. Liquor bottles were recovered from the vehicle, hinting to a drink-driving case.

Modi's farmer firewall: The subtext of India's trade standoff with USThe signal is clear: Donald Trump's pressure notwithstanding, India's farmers, and the politics they anchor, will not be sacrificed for a fast-tracked trade deal with the US

Why urban hobosexuality is quite a thing in India now (or at least becoming one)Hobosexuality refers to a pattern where someone enters a romantic relationship primarily for housing or financial support, often under the guise of a deep emotional connection.

Karnataka Congress cries 'credit chori' ahead of PM's Namma Metro line flag-offThe Karnataka Congress has accused the BJP of 'credit chori' over the Bengaluru Metro project, alleging it is taking undue credit for a project initiated under the UPA, even as central funding diminished under BJP rule.

CBSE approves open-book assessments for Class 9 from 2026-27The CBSE will roll out Open Book Assessments (OBAs) for Class 9 from the 2026-27 academic year, marking a major shift from rote memorization to competency-based learning. The move, backed by the NCFSE 2023 framework, aims to foster critical thinking, reduce exam stress, and promote real-world application of knowledge.

I'll never make films to sway people: John Abraham on his creative stand with TehranActor John Abraham discussed the challenges of censorship in Indian cinema, emphasising the delicate balance between creative freedom and regulatory oversight. He shared his journey with the film 'Tehran', highlighting the political sensitivities filmmakers face.

Watch: PM shares a laugh with Siddaramaiah, DK Shivakumar on Namma Metro ridePrime Minister Narendra Modi and Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, accompanied by other leaders including Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar, shared a light moment aboard a Bengaluru Metro train on the Yellow Line he inaugurated, with the leaders seen laughing together. However, it remains unclear what caused the leaders to burst into laughter.

After flagging off the much-awaited Yellow Line of Namma Metro -- expected to ease traffic congestion in several overcrowded corridors linking the city's IT hub -- the Prime Minister took a ride from RV Road (Ragigudda) to Electronic City Metro Station, interacting with students along the way.

Ahead of the inauguration, Congress leaders in Karnataka had criticised PM Modi and the BJP, accusing them of neglecting Bengaluru and claiming that funding for the Metro project had been reduced under the BJP-led central government.

VV Giri, a President who presented himself before the Supreme Court...and much moreBharat Ratna VV Giri, the fourth President of India, was a pioneering trade unionist, labour leader, and statesman whose integrity, selflessness, and ideals shaped the nation's industrial relations.

The quiet power of grief travelTravelling is not really about taking breaks from the Excel sheets, deadlines, or overworked weekends. Sometimes, it's to process loss, a bad breakup, maybe, but not exactly to escape from it.

Assured Rs 5 lakh, got Rs 5,000: Uttarkashi families protest over 'relief' chequesProtests erupted in Dharali and Harshil after families affected by the Uttarkashi flood were handed Rs 5,000 'relief' cheques, with residents accusing the Pushkar Singh Dhami-led Uttarakhand government of trivialising their losses.

Ladakh sent two crop seeds to space. Now, they will be plantedThe seeds were part of the "Emerging Space Nations' Space for Agriculture & Agriculture for Space" experiment, a collaborative initiative that explores how plants endure the unique stresses of space.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

No Bihar voter to be removed from rolls without notice: Poll body to top courtThe Election Commission, defending electoral rolls revision in poll-bound Bihar, told the Supreme Court it will follow principles of natural justice and give prior notice before any deletions.

Kohli and Djokovic's secret to sporting success: Power of visualisationWhile strict diet and training remain the sacrosanct principles of sporting success, several top athletes such as Virat Kohli, Novak Djokovic, and Cristiano Ronaldo, among others, practice the power of visualisation to achieve peak performance.

Abhishek-Aishwarya make rare airport sighting, daughter Aaradhya steals showThe Bachchan family created a buzz at Mumbai airport with their coordinated travel style and warm interactions. Videos of Abhishek Bachchan, Aishwarya Rai and daughter Aaradhya went viral on Sunday.

Low standard: Kalyan Banerjee snipes again at Mahua Moitra amid blazing rowSpeaking to reporters on Saturday, Kalyan Banerjee said that there is no point in talking about her and it was a wastage of time and energy.

Woman's protest call prompts Gurugram civic body to clear littered road within a dayA woman's now-viral post on X prompted the Gurugram civic body to clear a littered road within hours. Read on to know more.

Lawyer challenges her ex-IPS father's order dismissing UP cop, gets it overturnedThe Allahabad High Court found lapses in the departmental inquiry, ruling that procedures were not followed and ordering Bareilly Police to reinstate constable Taufiq Ahmad.

Brothers Ram Charan, Varun Tej, Sai Tej flaunt rugged look in viral Sunday gym picRam Charan and his cousins, Varun Tej and Sai Tej, hit the gym on Sunday. They shared the picture via a joint post on Instagram.

Ahaan Panday's mother Deanne shares note for son, thanks Saiyaara director and teamAhaan Panday's debut film 'Saiyaara' became a superhit, earning Rs 500 crore worldwide without any promotions. His mother, Deanne Panday, shared an emotional Instagram post thanking the film's team and expressing how proud she is of her son.

Saiyaara actors Ahaan Panday-Aneet Padda turn camera on paps, video goes viralAfter 'Saiyaara' became a huge hit, newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda had fun with Mumbai paparazzi by recording them, and the video quickly went viral.

War 2 advance booking begins, Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR shine in new promo'War 2', starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, has opened advance bookings in India with a high-action promo showcasing their spy showdown. Directed by Ayan Mukerji, the film is set for a massive August 14, 2025 release on 5,000 screens in Hindi alone.

sports.headline: Akash Deep on Ben Duckett send-off during Oval Test: He told me it was his dayAkash Deep revealed the conversation he had with Ben Duckett during the Oval Test and the reason why he gave the England opener a unique send-off. Akash put his hand on Duckett's shoulder and talked to him after the England opener was dismissed.

Shubman Gill exemplified the spirit of Gambhir: Karun Nair backs new Test skipperKarun Nair praised Shubman Gill's leadership after India's 2-2 Test series draw in England, saying the new skipper kept the team united and showed the same team-first spirit he learned from Gautam Gambhir.

No Neeraj vs Nadeem in Silesia Diamond League? Stars missing from start listFans will have to wait to see Neeraj Chopra and Arshad Nadeem battling it out as both men are missing from the start list for the Silesia Diamond League, scheduled to take place on August 16.

Babar Azam on a tightrope: Pakistan batter must raise his gameWI vs BAN: Babar Azam scored 47 runs in the first ODI before getting out to Gudakesh Motie. The talisman needs to raise his game, convert starts, and play more match-winning innings to reaffirm his status as one of Pakistan's very best.

Tell us how he died: Mohamed Salah slams UEFA for post on Palestinian Pele's deathLiverpool star Mohamed Salah criticised UEFA's tribute to Palestinian footballer Suleiman al-Obeid for omitting details of his death. Al-Obeid died in an Israeli attack while waiting for humanitarian aid in the southern Gaza Strip on Wednesday, August 6.

Samson shares Gambhir's 21 Ducks backing that boosted his confidenceSanju Samson revealed how India head coach Gautam Gambhir's quirky "21 ducks" assurance lifted his spirits after a poor T20I return. He also talked about Suryakumar Yadav's backing and consistent opportunities transforming his fortunes ahead of Asia Cup 2025 selection.

Kohli and Djokovic's secret to sporting success: Power of visualisationWhile strict diet and training remain the sacrosanct principles of sporting success, several top athletes such as Virat Kohli, Novak Djokovic, and Cristiano Ronaldo, among others, practice the power of visualisation to achieve peak performance.

Not a young team, a gun team: Karun Nair on Gautam Gambhir's dressing room mantraKarun Nair revealed that India coach Gautam Gambhir didn't want the team to think they're a team in transition and asked them not to think that they're a young side. Nair also revealed the exact moment that galvanised Team India during the England tour.

Darwin Nunez completes move to Al Hilal after forgetful Liverpool chapterDarwin Nunez's Liverpool stint ends with a €53 million move to Al Hilal. The Uruguayan leaves behind flashes of brilliance, inconsistent form, and a "what if" legacy as he seeks a fresh start in Saudi Arabia.

Animesh Kujur is the greatest Indian sprinter by far: World Athletics vice-presidentBhubaneshwar is set to see some of the top Indian athletes compete on Sunday, August 10. Among them is Animesh Kujur, India's fastest man, who has been regarded as the greatest Indian sprinter by the World Athletics vice-president, Adille Sumariwalla.

He also talked about Suryakumar Yadav's backing and consistent opportunities transforming his fortunes ahead of Asia Cup 2025 selection.

Nair also revealed the exact moment that galvanised Team India during the England tour.

Animesh Kujur is the greatest Indian sprinter by far: World Athletics vice-presidentBhubaneshwar is set to see some of the top Indian athletes compete on Sunday, August 10. Among them is Animesh Kujur, India's fastest man, who has been regarded as the greatest Indian sprinter by the World Athletics vice-president, Adille Sumariwalla.

How the Continental Tour sets the bedrock for India's Olympics dreamIndia is hosting its first-ever World Athletics Continental Tour. The former president of the Athletics Federation of India, Adille Sumariwalla, explained to India Today how this can turn out to be a watershed moment for the country.

Amid IPL trade rumours, Sanju Samson says RR means the world to himSanju Samson has opened up about his journey with the Rajasthan Royals and said that the franchise means the world to him amidst exit rumours. The latest reports state that Samson has signalled his intention to leave Royals ahead of IPL 2026.

Mohammed Siraj no longer a support bowler: Wasim Akram praises Oval Test heroWasim Akram has claimed that Mohammed Siraj is no longer just a support bowler and is now capable of leading the Indian team's attack, following his heroics at the Oval Test. Siraj picked up nine wickets during the match, including a five-wicket haul in the second innings, to help India secure a famous win.

An Australian who loves Bazball: Ricky Ponting makes surprising confessionRicky Ponting praises Bazball's evolution, says Australia now better prepared for England's refined approach ahead of next Ashes. He suggested that England's opening pair could be the key to reclaiming the urn.

Akash Deep reveals priceless advice from Virat Kohli, MS DhoniIndia fast bowler Akash Deep, who took 13 wickets on the England tour—including a six-wicket haul—shared the valuable advice he received from MS Dhoni and Virat Kohli.

Chennai Grand Masters: Keymer remains unbeaten, Erigaisi holds secondVincent Keymer stays perfect at Chennai Grand Masters, while Arjun Erigaisi climbs to second after defeating Ray Robson in Round 3.

Gill, Bumrah draw big bucks, Test jerseys auctioned for Rs 5 lakhShubman Gill and Jasprit Bumrah fetched the big bucks as their jerseys were auctioned off for a hefty amount as part of the Ruth Strauss Foundation's charitable cause.

Nadal becomes father again, welcomes baby boy Miquel with wife MariaRafael Nadal and his wife Maria Francisca Perello became parents on August 7 and named their baby boy, Miquel. They became parents for the first time in 2022 after marrying in 2019.

Akash Deep reveals priceless advice from Virat Kohli, MS DhoniIndia fast bowler Akash Deep, who took 13 wickets on the England tour—including a six-wicket haul—shared the valuable advice he received from MS Dhoni and Virat Kohli.

Chennai Grand Masters: Keymer remains unbeaten, Erigaisi holds secondVincent Keymer stays perfect at Chennai Grand Masters, while Arjun Erigaisi climbs to second after defeating Ray Robson in Round 3.

Gill, Bumrah draw big bucks, Test jerseys auctioned for Rs 5 lakhShubman Gill and Jasprit Bumrah fetched the big bucks as their jerseys were auctioned off for a hefty amount as part of the Ruth Strauss Foundation's charitable cause.

Nadal becomes father again, welcomes baby boy Miquel with wife MariaRafael Nadal and his wife Maria Francisca Perello became parents on August 7 and named their baby boy, Miquel. They became parents for the first time in 2022 after marrying in 2019.

Australia vs South Africa T20I series: Squads, all you need to knowAUS vs SA: Mitchell Marsh's Australia and Aiden Markram's South Africa will be up against each other in a three-match T20I series to be held from August 10 to 16 in Darwin and Cairns.

Samson, Ashwin in awe of Suryavanshi: Quality of his shots shocked meBoth Sanju Samson and R Ashwin were left in awe of the talent that is Vaibhav Suryavanshi. The former RR teammates reflected on how the young star impressed in his first IPL season.

Andy Roddick backs Naomi Osaka after backlash over Mboko controversyAndy Roddick defended Naomi Osaka after criticism of her brief runner-up speech following a 6-4, 4-6, 1-6 loss to Victoria Mboko in the 2025 Montreal Open final. He argued that expecting players to deliver polished remarks immediately after a tough defeat is unrealistic.

Srikkanth on Ashwin's rumoured exit: CSK want to win championshipsFormer India cricketer Krishnamachari Srikkanth says Ravichandran Ashwin's possible CSK exit could aid the team's rebuild, urging focus on youth and results in the quest for future IPL titles.

Shaheen Afridi joins Wasim Akram in elite club with 4-wicket haul in 1st ODIPAK vs WI: Shaheen Shah Afridi helped Pakistan defeat West Indies by five wickets in the first ODI after taking four wickets at the Brian Lara Stadium in Tarouba, Trinidad.

David de Gea given fitting tribute on Old Trafford return: WatchDavid de Gea returns to Old Trafford with Fiorentina, receiving a tribute as Manchester United honour his decorated career at the club. The former goalkeeper was the last remaining member of Sir Alex Ferguson's final squad, and he left after his contract expired in 2023.

New Zealand claim series against Zimbabwe with their biggest Test winMitchell Santner's New Zealand won their Test series 2-0 against Zimbabwe after winning the second game in Bulawayo by an innings and 359 runs. The Kiwis also racked up the third-biggest win ever in Test history.

73 all out: India A Women slump to humiliating defeat as Australia A bag seriesRadha Yadav's India A Women lost the second T20 by 114 runs as Australia claimed the three-match series 2-0 with a dominating win at the Great Barrier Reef Arena in Mackay.

Lhakpa Tsering set for 2025 Asia Cross Country Rally challenge for IndiaIndian rally ace Lhakpa Tsering to race in AXCR 2025, tackling 3,400 km in Thailand with support from JK Tyre and Arunachal Pradesh sponsors.

Not mentally fit: Osaka slammed for cold attitude after Mboko's winFour-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka faced backlash after omitting congratulations to 18-year-old Victoria Mboko in her 2025 Montreal Open runner-up speech, despite Mboko's stunning title run.

Liverpool favourites due to 2024/25 league win, not spending spree: Arne SlotArne Slot has hit back at claims that Liverpool are favourites to win the Premier League this season because of their summer spending. Liverpool have made some big signing already before the new season gets underway.

Manchester United confirm Benjamin Sesko signing from RB LeipzigManchester United have made their fourth signing of the summer transfer window by bringing in the Slovenian international striker, Benjamin Sesko from RB Leipzig.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
